intro: Crenularia cephalantha, commonly known as the Cape snowball, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance and ability to store water make it well adapted to arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
